role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined data engineering role focusing on ETL, data warehousing, and integration with specific tool requirements

strength_details: IBM is stable, established technology company with global presence
Clear data engineering focus with ETL and data integration responsibilities
Cloud migration skills development opportunity with MS-Azure
concern_details: Legacy ETL tool (Informatica PowerCenter) - may limit modern data engineering experience
No learning budget, mentorship, or career growth opportunities mentioned
Vague role requirements and unclear reporting structure
No salary, benefits, or compensation information disclosed
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers (2-5 years) seeking stable corporate environment
Engineers with ETL/data integration background looking to transition to cloud
Candidates wanting to gain consulting/client-facing experience
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and compensation structure
Understand team size, composition, and reporting structure
Clarify current tech stack and modernization plans
Discuss career progression and learning opportunities
leverage_details: Strong Informatica PowerCenter experience is specific requirement
Local Mumbai candidate with work authorization advantage
summary.overall_assessment: Stable corporate data engineering role at IBM with traditional ETL focus. Good for candidates seeking enterprise experience and cloud transition, but limited growth opportunities and legacy technology stack. Main trade-offs are unclear compensation and potential consulting pressure.
